questions.question_text: What do you need to do to support ftp service on a media interface?

choices.D: Set the hip-address parameter to enabled.
choices.C: Add the IP address of the interface in the hip-ip-list and ftp-address parameters.
choices.B: Set the ftp-address parameter to enabled.
choices.A: Add the IP address of the remote device to the hip-ip-list and ftp-address parameters.
choices.E: Add the IP address of the interface in the hip-ip-list and telnet-address parameters.

choices.B: The configuration requires a home realm to be defined, which can make privacy harder to achieve.
choices.C: The configuration requires you to enable SIP-NAT bridging, which is complex.
choices.E: The performance is poor relative to other models.
choices.D: The architecture is simple, and really designed for lab environments.

questions.question_text: What is the drawback of configuring Policy-Based Realm Bridging (PBRB) without the assistance of Header Manipulation Rules (HMRs)?

comments.content: C correct , Establishing a SIP NAT bridge lets you route every SIP Request message through the backbone

questions.question_text:
You want to configure the maximum duration in seconds of any session in the Session Border Controller.
How would you accomplish this?

choices.E: Navigate to the media-manager configuration element and configure the latching parameter.
choices.A: Navigate to the media-manager configuration element and configure the max-signaling-bandwidth parameter.
choices.D: Navigate to the sip-config configuration element and configure the flow-time-limit parameter.
choices.B: Navigate to the media-manager configuration element and configure the flow-time-limit parameter.
choices.C: Navigate to the sip-config configuration element and configure the operation-mode parameter.

discussion.content:
The flow-time-limit can be configured in media-manager
Correct answer: B

questions.question_text:
You were working with the Session Border Controller in configuration mode and you forgot to close your session. Your colleague who connected after you left says that he cannot enter into configuration mode.
Why is your colleague not able to configure the Session Border Controller?

discussion.content: Pardon, C is the correct answer.

A:
 Session Border Controller does not allow more than one configuration session simultaneously

choices.E: The Session Border Controller supports only five simultaneous Telnet/SSH sessions.
choices.D: The Session Border Controller supports only 10 simultaneous configuration sessions.
choices.A: The Session Border Controller does not allow more than one configuration session within 24 hours.
choices.B: The Session Border Controller does not support Telnet/SSH timeouts.
choices.C: The Session Border Controller supports only one simultaneous configuration session, and the Telnet/SSH timeouts are set to 0.

questions.question_text:
You need to configure the Session Border Controller to perform load balancing between two downstream SIP proxies.
Which option shows the configuration elements that you should configure for the load balancing feature?
